Pre-Game Insights: India is flying in the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 as they have won all their matches played till now in the competition.
India started by beating Australia, but since then they have gathered momentum and went into a winning streak demolishing their oppositions.
The last two matches have been benchmarks of domination as India have bowled out South Africa and Sri Lanka for 83 and 55 runs respectively.
Everyone has been in form scoring runs regularly and the bowling has been the icing on the cake derailing opposition top orders in no time.
India will look to keep their winning streak intact and also rotate some key players.
Netherlands have been methodical and impressive in their campaign despite not being familiar with the conditions.
An area Netherlands would like to be better ahead of ending their tournament is the batting performing as a unit.
It will be a tough challenge against the Indian bowling.
Good news for the fans, there is no forecast of rain during the duration of the match on November 12, 2023.
The temperature is all set to stay between 21-27 degree Celsius.
It is going to be a day with hazy sunshine but the precipitation chances are absolutely negligible.
The pitch at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium is hard and the bounce is true with not much assistance for either the seamers or spinners.
Batters enjoy the conditions as they get good value for shots and can play across the line trusting the bounce of the surface.
Fans can expect a high scoring match again.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain has been a spoilsport in the last game between New Zealand and Pakistan at Bengaluru where the match was washed out due to rain and Pakistan were declared winners via the DLS method.
